tweets.text:
We’re looking forward to working closely with our partners to develop 25 innovative projects to respond to flooding across England.

The Flood and Coastal Resilience Innovation Programme will inform our approach to the climate crisis in the run-up to #COP26 and beyond. https://t.co/uLncFImWcY

tweets.text: @JamieMillarZZ Thanks for making us aware, Jamie. Could you please report the details of this incident to our emergency hotline so that our local specialist teams can investigate. The freephone number is 0800 807060 and they would appreciate any specific info and exact location details. Thanks.

We are working with @EnvAgency  and  @FOIM_IlkleyMoor on a natural flood management  project to slow the flow of water from Ilkley Moor into Backstone Beck which flows into the River Wharfe. This work will also help peat bogs to form which store carbon.   https://t.co/Eh3svE5omT https://t.co/TtOAlMqpSr

urls.title: Launching the flood and coastal resilience innovation programme
urls.description: Today, 25 pioneering projects have received a share of £150 million of funding to put new aspects of the National Strategy for Flood and Coastal Erosion Risk Management to the test.

tweets.text:
3 of the 25 projects that have secured a share of £150m funding to test new approaches to #flood risk management are in the #NorthWest! 

They include proactive property flood resilience, natural flood management & enhancing the resilience of our coasts

👉https://t.co/my7LxnuXmK https://t.co/oh2QUE5QDX

Our #SuDS planters at Holy Trinity CofE Junior School have been transformed with wildlife features, planting and water chutes! All set to spring into life as the warm weather approaches.
#SuDS #SuDSinschools #SuDSnotFloods @EnvAgencySE @SuttonCouncil @Sudsulike @Thames_RvrsTrst https://t.co/j32hLwKl9y

urls.title: Vital tidal flood defence scheme complete, making Hull more resilient to sea level rise
urls.description: The scheme, delivered for the Environment Agency, is part of £200 million investment in flood risk management across Hull and East Yorkshire

tweets.text:
We've completed a major flood alleviation scheme with @MottMacDonald on behalf of @EnvAgency to improve protection against climate change and sea level rise for thousands of homes and businesses in Hull. 

https://t.co/Af7Jco47Kf https://t.co/EtIhSxauW7

tweets.text: This is part of the upper reaches of the Ivel. @EnvAgencySE @AffinityWater take note. The habitat is recovering. Needs water all year. Great for our well-being and essential for biodiversity. What’s it worth EA ? Put a cost benefit value on it. @AquiferChalk @Feargal_Sharkey https://t.co/RTrEO60U4p

After the modelling work with @YorkshireiCASP the monitoring with @SCORE_NSR @daleslandnet it’s so good to see @moorsforfuture undertaking the moorland works on this @bradfordmdc & @EnvAgencyYNE NFM project 👏🏼 https://t.co/a1BHGuf0xt

Today 25 pioneering projects have received a share of £150 million of funding to test new approaches to flood risk management in a #ClimateCrisis. Here’s my blog about the whole programme: https://t.co/FK8ljCD0yj #adaptourworld #COP26 #TogetherforOurPlanet https://t.co/MJTTuIb4Ck

We want to drive innovation in flood and coastal resilience.

That’s why we’re investing £150 million to test and develop new ways to respond to flooding across England.

Find out more: https://t.co/2qDmoVtCBc https://t.co/zX6OvBNuOm
